meanings.definition: The production of new frequencies in a system due to the interaction of two or more signals.
meanings.sent1: Intermodulation can create unexpected sounds in a device.
meanings.sent2: The intermodulation of signals in the circuit led to interference.
meanings.sent3: The intermodulation of voices on the phone call made it sound like a choir.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra of frequencies, intermodulation played the role of a conductor.
meanings.sent5: The intermodulation of colors in the painting added depth and richness.

meanings.definition: The distortion of audio or radio signals caused by the mixing of different frequencies.
meanings.sent1: The intermodulation of radio waves resulted in static on the broadcast.
meanings.sent2: Audio quality suffered due to intermodulation in the recording equipment.
meanings.sent3: The intermodulation of music notes made the song sound like a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent4: In the symphony of sounds, intermodulation was the discordant note.
meanings.sent5: The intermodulation of voices on the radio show created a confusing cacophony.
